body_content.explanation: (of a plant or animal) formed from two different types of plant or animal:
examples: Genetically speaking, thesehybridised creatures would not quite be full clones.
Many people are allergic to hybridized peanuts.

body_content.explanation: formed from two different things and having features of both of them:
examples: Industrial nations now have hybridized styles of government which are part capitalist, part socialist, and part mercantile (run by big business).
The artist is interested in the hybridised culture of contemporary society.
